definitions: a mythological spirit of nature imagined as a beautiful maiden inhabiting rivers, woods, or other locations
an immature form of an insect that does not change greatly as it grows, e.g., a dragonfly, mayfly, or grasshopper
a type of fly used in angling, representing a aquatic stage or form of an insect
examples: The nymphs danced in the forest.
The insect's life cycle includes a nymph stage.
The artwork depicts a Greek nymph.
He tied a nymph fly to his fishing line.
